definitions.definition: the introduction of new things, ideas or ways of doing something

examples.text: The company is very interested in product design and innovation.
Too strict a regulatory system will stifle innovation.
Technical innovation may occur directly in the factory.
industries where constant product innovation is a criterion for survival

definitions.definition: a new idea, way of doing something, etc. that has been introduced or discovered

examples.text: technological innovations designed to save energy
Many innovations were introduced by the 1919 Act.
She believed she had come up with one of the greatest innovations of modern times.
Mathematical astronomy was the great innovation by the Greeks of the 5th century BC.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin innovatio(n-), from the verb innovare, from in- ‘into’ + novare ‘make new’ (from novus ‘new’).
